subject: RE: [junit] Junit and Ant classpath problem
msgSnippet: It seems to me that if it can t find the JUnit task it is because of not having optional.jar on the classpath, not because junit.jar isn t there. Josh ...
messageBody:
It seems to me that if it can't find the JUnit task it is because of not
having optional.jar on the classpath, not because junit.jar isn't there.

Josh

-----Original Message-----
From: feec888 [mailto:fee@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 17, 2002 1:07 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Junit and Ant classpath problem


I have been looking at the Junit and Ant classpath problem in
this
list and the Ant user list and I am still pretty confused of
what I
should do to solve this problem. Basically I want to use the
<classpath> tag and avoid putting the junit.jar in ANT_HOME/lib
directory. I am positive I have the right syntax and the jars
in the
<classpath>.

Is there a simpler and concrete way to solve the problem of
"could
not find Junit task"? The suggestions of modifyingthe
optional.jar
seems complicated. I am using Junit3.8.1 and Ant 1.5.

Thanks in advance.

Fee
